    • Method Detail

      • start

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> start()
        Method called to start the parsing
        Returns:
        the list of rules used by the parser, or null if there was an error during parsing

      • getTree

        public ParseTree getTree()
        Get the parse tree
        Returns:
        parse tree

      • match

        public static void match(Symbol symbol,
                         java.util.List<ParseTree> children)
        Matches a symbol on the input to the expected symbol given by the grammar. In case there is an error, the errorMessage variable is updated, and if the user wished to have a verbose output, he is shown a detailed error message indicating the position of the erroe and the expected symbol. This function also adds a symbol to the parse tree of the calling entity.
        Parameters:
        symbol - expected next symbol, according to the grammar
        children - children of the node calling match

      • getVerbose

        public static java.lang.String getVerbose(int i)
        Allows to get the litteral form of a rule, required when in verbose mode.
        Parameters:
        i - number of the rule
        Returns:
        string corresponding to the rule

      • printVerbose

        public static void printVerbose(int i)
        Prints the verbose rule as detailed in function getVerbose
        Parameters:
        i - number of the rule to be printed in verbose mode
